item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Anna Politkovskaya
item.description: "People sometimes pay with their lives for saying aloud what they think. In fact, one can even get killed for giving me information. I am not the only one in danger. I have examples that prove it." -- Anna Politkovskaya

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Omar Khayyám
item.description: "The Moving Finger writes; and, having writ, Moves on: nor all thy Piety nor Wit Shall lure it back to cancel half a Line, Nor all thy Tears wash out a Word of it." -- Omar Khayyám

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Wrinkles should merely indicate where the smiles have been." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Forgive him, for he believes that the customs of his tribe are the laws of nature!" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "It is curious that physical courage should be so common in the world and moral courage so rare." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Noise proves nothing. Often a hen who has laid an egg cackles as if she had laid an asteroid." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "If you live long enough, you'll see that every victory turns into a defeat." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does. It is up to you to give [life] a meaning." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Ali Ibn Abu Talib
item.description: "He who is greedy is disgraced; he who discloses his hardship will always be humiliated; he who has no control over his tongue will often have to face discomfort." -- Ali Ibn Abu Talib

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Ali Ibn Abu Talib
item.description: "Do not feel ashamed if the amount of charity is small because to refuse the needy is an act of greater shame." -- Ali Ibn Abu Talib

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Paths are made by walking" -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Friedrich von Schiller
item.description: "World history is the world's court" -- Friedrich von Schiller

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Men are equal; it is not birth but virtue that makes the difference." -- Voltaire

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Francois de Salignac de La Mothe- Fenelon
item.description: "All wars are civil wars because all men are brothers... Each one owes infinitely more to the human race than to the particular country in which he was born." -- Francois de Salignac de La Mothe- Fenelon

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "How good music and bad reasons sound when one marches against an enemy." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Which is worse? the wolf who cries before eating the lamb or the wolf who does not." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Thomas Fuller
item.description: "It is said that the darkest hour of the night comes just before the dawn." -- Thomas Fuller

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description:
"The Road Not Taken
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I— I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "No nation was ever so virtuous as each believes itself, and none was ever so wicked as each believes the other." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description: "And homeless near a thousand homes I stood, And near a thousand tables pined and wanted food." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Robert Ingersoll
item.description: "The man who does not do his own thinking is a slave, and is a traitor to himself and to his fellowmen." -- Robert Ingersoll

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Tagore
item.description: "The water in a vessel is sparkling; the water in the sea is dark. The small truth has words which are clear; the great truth has great silence." -- Tagore

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Tagore
item.description: "I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy." -- Tagore

item.title: Mustafa add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "War does not determine who is right - only who is left." -- Bertrand Russell
